snippet: Rahm Emanuel’s departure from the Obama campaign reflects Democrats’ worries about the fund-raising gap enjoyed by Republican-leaning outside groups.
abstract: Senior Democrats enlist Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel to focus on raising money for Democratic super PACs, which are being vastly outspent by their Republican counterparts; Emanuel will leave his role as honorary co-chairman of Obama's reelection campaign to organize the effort.
lead_paragraph: Rahm Emanuel’s departure from the Obama campaign reflects Democrats’ worries about the fund-raising gap enjoyed by Republican-leaning outside groups.

headline.seo: Emanuel Leaves Campaign to Help ‘Super PACs’
headline.main: Emanuel Takes On New Role as a ‘Super PAC’ Wrangler
headline.print_headline: Emanuel Takes On New Role As a ‘Super PAC’ Wrangler
